abstracts.cdata!:
The First Agricultural Sector Adjustment
            Credit Project will support the first phase of
            implementation of the Government's program of
            adjustments in the agricultural sector.  The principal
            objectives of the program are to stimulate sectoral growth
            through promoting intensification of production and better
            use of Kenya's limited land; improve producer
            incentives; and expand the flow of investment resources to
            the sector.  Above all, the program is geared to lifting the
            obstacles to increased production by the 1.9 million
            smallholder farm families who are the backbone of
            Kenya's agricultural sector.  To achieve these
            objectives, actions have been taken and others will be
            implemented in the following two years. They will include
            (i) improving the availability of key agricultural inputs
            and services; (ii) increasing production and investment
            incentives, (iii) implementing programs to address critical
            parastatal problems; (iv) launching a major restructuring of
            the public investment and expenditure program; and (v)
            increasing flows of credit and expanding access to credit,
            particularly for smallholders.  The foreign exchange
            provided by the Credits will be used to finance an agreed
            program of imports of inputs needed for the sector.
